sen.j: 水羊羹（みずようかん）は、菓子である羊羹の一種である。
sen.e: Mizu-yokan is Japanese confectionery, and is a type of yokan (azuki-bean jelly).
Mizu-yokan is Japanese confectionery, and is a type of yokan (azuki-bean jelly).
Mizu-yokan is Japanese confectionery, and is a type of yokan (azuki-bean jelly).

sen.j: 製法
sen.e: Process of making
Process of making
Process of making

sen.j: 一般的な羊羹と同様に砂糖と餡を寒天で固めるのが典型的な製法である。
sen.e: The typical way of making mizu-yokan is similar to that of regular yokan, which is to mix sugar and bean jam together and make it hard by cooking with agar.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The typical way of making mizu-yokan is similar to that of regular yokan, which is to mix sugar and bean jam together and make it hard by cooking with agar.
The typical way of making mizu-yokan is similar to that of regular yokan, which is to mix sugar and bean jam together and make it hard by cooking with agar.

sen.j: 羊羹よりも水分を多くして柔らかく作る。
sen.e: Mizu-yokan is softer than regular yokan because it is made to contain more water.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Mizu-yokan is softer than regular yokan because it is made to contain more water.
Mizu-yokan is softer than regular yokan because it is made to contain more water.

sen.j: 餡は小倉餡を用いるのが一般的であるが、白餡の水羊羹なども存在する。
sen.e: Generally ogura-an (sweet azuki bean paste containing both mashed and whole beans) is used for making mizu-yokan, but sometimes white bean jam is used instead.
Generally ogura-an (sweet azuki bean paste containing both mashed and whole beans) is used for making mizu-yokan, but sometimes white bean jam is used instead.
Generally ogura-an (sweet azuki bean paste containing both mashed and whole beans) is used for making mizu-yokan, but sometimes white bean jam is used instead.

sen.j: また、餡を使わずに黒砂糖を使う製法もある。
sen.e: Another way of making mizu-yokan is to use brown sugar instead of bean jam.
Another way of making mizu-yokan is to use brown sugar instead of bean jam.
Another way of making mizu-yokan is to use brown sugar instead of bean jam.

sen.j: 水で戻した後でちぎって細かくした寒天を水（寒天一本あたり500－600cc）とともに鍋に入れて沸騰させる。
sen.e: First, soak a bar of agar in water and tear it into small pieces, and boil it in a pan with water (500-600cc of water per one bar of agar).
First, soak a bar of agar in water and tear it into small pieces, and boil it in a pan with water (500-600cc of water per one bar of agar).
First, soak a bar of agar in water and tear it into small pieces, and boil it in a pan with water (500-600cc of water per one bar of agar).

sen.j: 寒天が湯の中で溶解した後に砂糖と餡（少量の水で溶かした葛粉を入れる場合もある）を入れて再び沸騰させる。
sen.e: When the agar is dissolved, add sugar and bean jam in the pan (in some cases, also add powdered arrowroot mixed with little water) and heat it to a boil again.
When the agar is dissolved, add sugar and bean jam in the pan (in some cases, also add powdered arrowroot mixed with a little water) and heat it to a boil again.
sen.cmt: little water→a little waterとしました。
sen.e: When the agar is dissolved, add sugar and bean jam in the pan (in some cases, also add powdered arrowroot mixed with a little water) and heat it to a boil again.

sen.j: これを冷ましたものを漉して容器に流し込んだ後に冷やすと水羊羹となる。
sen.e: Cool the material in the pan, strain it, put it in a container and allow to cool until it becomes hard.
Cool the material in the pan, strain it, put it in a container and allow it to cool until it becomes hard.
sen.cmt: allow to cool→allow it to coolとしました。
sen.e: Cool the material in the pan, strain it, put it in a container and allow it to cool until it becomes hard.

sen.j: 形態
sen.e: Form
Form
Form

sen.j: 一般的に、アルミ缶やプラスチックカップに入った製品が市販されている。
sen.e: Most mizu-yokan is sold in an aluminum can or a plastic cup.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Most mizu-yokan is sold in an aluminum can or a plastic cup.
Most mizu-yokan is sold in an aluminum can or a plastic cup.

sen.j: 高級菓子店では竹筒に入った製品も販売されている。
sen.e: Some fancy confectioners sell mizu-yokan contained in a bamboo cylinder.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some fancy confectioners sell mizu-yokan contained in a bamboo cylinder.
Some fancy confectioners sell mizu-yokan contained in a bamboo cylinder.

sen.j: かつては、大きな木枠の箱に流しこみ、切り売りしていた。
sen.e: Mizu-yokan used to be made in a large wooden container and sold by the piece.
Mizu-yokan used to be made in a large wooden container and sold by the piece.
Mizu-yokan used to be made in a large wooden container and sold by the piece.

sen.j: その名残として福井県や石川県では、厚紙製の箱に羊羹を流し込んで販売する店がみられる。
sen.e: As a vestige of that, some stores in Fukui Prefecture and Ishikawa Prefecture make mizu-yokan in a paperboard container to sell.
As a vestige of that, some stores in Fukui Prefecture and Ishikawa Prefecture make mizu-yokan in a paperboard container to sell.
As a vestige of that, some stores in Fukui Prefecture and Ishikawa Prefecture make mizu-yokan in a paperboard container to sell.

sen.j: 季節
sen.e: Season
Season
Season

sen.j: 夏に冷やして食べる事が多く俳句の季語も夏である。
sen.e: Mizu-yokan is often eaten chilled in summer, and it is also a kigo (a season word) of summer for haiku (Japanese seventeen-syllable poem).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Mizu-yokan is often eaten chilled in summer, and it is also a kigo (a season word) of summer for haiku (Japanese seventeen-syllable poem).
Mizu-yokan is often eaten chilled in summer, and it is also a kigo (a season word) of summer for haiku (Japanese seventeen-syllable poem).

sen.j: 福井県をはじめとして、大阪府（能勢町周辺）京都府（亀岡市周辺）、石川県（輪島市周辺）、新潟県（上越市周辺）、山形県（鶴岡市周辺）、栃木県（日光市周辺）などでは主に冬に食べる。
sen.e: However, mizu-yokan is mostly eaten in winter in places like Fukui Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture (in the Nose-cho area), Kyoto Prefecture (in the Kameoka City area), Ishikawa Prefecture (in the Wajima City area), Niigata Prefecture (in the Joetsu City area), Yamagata Prefecture (in the Tsuruoka City area), and Tochigi Prefecture (in the Nikko City area).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, mizu-yokan is mostly eaten in winter in places like Fukui Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture (in the Nose-cho area), Kyoto Prefecture (in the Kameoka City area), Ishikawa Prefecture (in the Wajima City area), Niigata Prefecture (in the Joetsu City area), Yamagata Prefecture (in the Tsuruoka City area), and Tochigi Prefecture (in the Nikko City area).

However, mizu-yokan is mostly eaten in winter in places like Fukui Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture (in the Nose-cho area), Kyoto Prefecture (in the Kameoka City area), Ishikawa Prefecture (in the Wajima City area), Niigata Prefecture (in the Joetsu City area), Yamagata Prefecture (in the Tsuruoka City area), and Tochigi Prefecture (in the Nikko City area).

sen.j: 福井県のものは黒砂糖と寒天を使用し、水分の多い極柔らかい仕上がりの、かなり独自の食品である。
sen.e: Mizu-yokan made in Fukui Prefecture is very different; it is made with brown sugar and agar, and the texture is extremely soft since it contains a lot of water.
Mizu-yokan made in Fukui Prefecture is very different; it is made with brown sugar and agar, and the texture is extremely soft since it contains a lot of water.
Mizu-yokan made in Fukui Prefecture is very different; it is made with brown sugar and agar, and the texture is extremely soft since it contains a lot of water.

sen.j: 福井県・亀岡市・能勢町では「丁稚羊羹」と呼ぶ例が見られる。
sen.e: In Fukui Prefecture, Kameoka City (Kyoto Prefecture), and Nose-cho (Osaka Prefecture), mizu-yokan is sometimes called decchi-yokan (cheap yokan containing less azuki beans and sugar).
sen.cmt: 「福井県・亀岡市・能勢町」と並べると福井県のみ県名が示されることになるので、Kameoka City (Kyoto Prefecture), and Nose-cho (Osaka Prefecture)と、（ ）で県名を補足しました。
sen.e: In Fukui Prefecture, Kameoka City (Kyoto Prefecture), and Nose-cho (Osaka Prefecture), mizu-yokan is sometimes called detchi-yokan (cheap yokan containing less azuki beans and sugar).
In Fukui Prefecture, Kameoka City (Kyoto Prefecture), and Nose-cho (Osaka Prefecture), mizu-yokan is sometimes called detchi-yokan (cheap yokan containing less azuki beans and sugar).

sen.j: 京都市や滋賀県の近江八幡市などで作られる「丁稚羊羹」とは製法も食感は全くことなる。
sen.e: The making process and texture are very different from decchi-yokan made in Kyoto Prefecture and Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture.
The making process and texture are very different from detchi-yokan made in Kyoto Prefecture and Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture.
The making process and texture are very different from detchi-yokan made in Kyoto Prefecture and Omihachiman City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 三重県の伊賀地方、奈良県の「丁稚羊羹」は、福井の水羊羹に形態が近い。
sen.e: Decchi-yokan made in Nara Prefecture and in the Iga district in Mie Prefecture is similar to the mizu-yokan made in Fukui Prefecture.
Detchi-yokan made in Nara Prefecture and in the Iga district in Mie Prefecture is similar to the mizu-yokan made in Fukui Prefecture.
Detchi-yokan made in Nara Prefecture and in the Iga district in Mie Prefecture is similar to the mizu-yokan made in Fukui Prefecture.
